content.description:
Question refers to the following image.

The Metropolitan Museum of Art/Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Klaus G. Perls, 1990
content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

Correctly attribute the work shown to the specific African culture in which it was created.

Using at least two examples of specific visual evidence, justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and another work of this type created by the same African culture.

Using at least two examples of specific visual and/or contextual evidence, explain how the work reflects the cultural context for which works of this type were created.
